snippet: Even with obesity rising, and despite its toll on medical costs, access to bucket-size sodas was widely seen as a personal choice.
abstract: Many New Yorkers say good riddance to proposed ban on large-size soft drinks, in many ways echoing the rationale of the State Supreme Court justice who overturned ban; many say they resent 'nanny state' mentality of Bloomberg administration and view access to bucket-size sodas as a personal choice despite health risks.

byline.contributor: Priyanka Borpujari and Luke Hammill contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Even with obesity rising, and despite its toll on medical costs, access to bucket-size sodas was widely seen as a personal choice.

headline.seo: Many in N.Y. Say Good Riddance to Big-Soda Ban
headline.main: Cheering a Setback to the City’s Drink Limits
headline.print_headline: Cheering a Setback to the City’s Drink Limits
